channel.title: Please Help me~
channel.description:
[size=12pt]Well it seems that my CMD has been deleted off my computer but i need my cmd to run any sources/clients. So without a CMD my coding/running a server has come to a absolute complete halt. But i dont want it to :( It wasnt only my shourtcut that got deleted it was the whole thing. [Picture below] :([/size]
[IMG]http://i48.tinypic.com/wrxhlv.png[/img]
[size=12pt]I was wondering if there is anyway to get my cmd back or.. get a new one. Beacuse i just started coding and i loved it but... Shit happens so here i am.
would be AMAZINGLY AWSOME if ANYONE could HELP ME, ive looked everywhere for cmd, cmd.exe, ect.... :([/size]

item.title: Please Help me~
item.dc:creator: @Skyro Arbe
item.description:
@Skyro wrote:

That’s because you’re looking in the folder section.

Just type this in the ‘Start Bar’ > ‘Run Spot’ > ‘Cmd.exe’ (No Quotation Marks).

Read full topic

item.title: Please Help me~
item.dc:creator: @PvP_Bobby PvP Bobby
item.description:
@PvP_Bobby wrote:

Why are you looking at the Folder Names in search of cmd.exe ?

cmd.exe is supposed to be in the System32 Folder… its just not a folder so of course it wouldn’t be up there. Look below next to the other files in System32. Also, do me a favor and try this…

Start -> Run -> type in cmd and hit [Enter]

If you think “I dont have a [run] what the hell does he mean???” … Well then read below…
Start -> In the bar that says “Search programs and files” -> Type CMD and hit enter.

If cmd pops up you have other issues with your “coding/running a server”. Quick question. Why has it halted your “coding?” Why aren’t you using an IDE for compiling needs?

If your cmd.exe does not pop up… Well I’ll be damned you really screwed yourself on that one… In your picture you see the “Search System32” field. Go 1 directory up (being “Windows”) and search for “cmd.exe.”

Read full topic

cmd.exe isnt supposed to be there
